TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit AxImporter extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Imports ActiveX controls and generates a wrapper that can be accessed by a designer.

remarks.format: ## Remarks To generate an ActiveX wrapper for an ActiveX control, first create or obtain an instance of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Design.AxImporter> class. The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Design.AxImporter> constructor accepts an <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Design.AxImporter.Options> object, which sets options for the importer, such as the filename for the wrapper .dll to generate and the output directory to generate the wrapper to. To generate the ActiveX wrapper, call the appropriate Generate method. To generate from a file, call <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Design.AxImporter.GenerateFromFile%2A>. To generate from a type library, call <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Design.AxImporter.GenerateFromTypeLibrary%2A>. The string that is returned will consist of an assembly qualified name (example: "Namespace.Type,Assembly") for the type an ActiveX wrapper was generated for. The wrapper for the ActiveX control will be generated in the .dll file specified in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Design.AxImporter.Options.outputName> property of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Design.AxImporter.Options> passed to the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Design.AxImporter> constructor. The type can be loaded or queried using <xref:System.Reflection> and treated as an ordinary managed type. You can also call the `GetOcx` method of the type to retrieve a COM interface to the object, if the object supports this.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(class System.Windows.Forms.Design.AxImporter/Options options) cil managed

Docs.param: An that indicates the options for the ActiveX control importer to use.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
Generates a wrapper for an ActiveX control for use in the design-time environment.
